original_solution_mapping.L1: Earl will have $90 - $28 = $<<90-28=62>>62 after paying off his debt to Fred.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Fred will have $48 + $28 = $<<48+28=76>>76 after being paid by Earl.
original_solution_mapping.L3: But then Fred will have $76 - $32 = $<<76-32=44>>44 after paying Greg.
original_solution_mapping.L4: Greg will have $36 + $32 = $<<36+32=68>>68 after Fred paid him.
original_solution_mapping.L5: Then, Greg will have $68 - $40 = $<<68-40=28>>28 after paying off his debt to Earl.
original_solution_mapping.L7: So together, Greg and Earl will have $28 + $102 = $<<28+102=130>>130.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 860.
    Returns: the total amount Greg and Earl will have together in dollars.
    """
    # L1
    earl_initial_money = 90 # Earl has $90
    earl_owes_fred = 28 # Earl owes Fred $28
    earl_after_paying_fred = earl_initial_money - earl_owes_fred

    # L2
    fred_initial_money = 48 # Fred has $48
    fred_after_earl_pays = fred_initial_money + earl_owes_fred

    # L3
    fred_owes_greg = 32 # Fred owes Greg $32
    fred_after_paying_greg = fred_after_earl_pays - fred_owes_greg

    # L4
    greg_initial_money = 36 # Greg has $36
    greg_after_fred_pays = greg_initial_money + fred_owes_greg

    # L5
    greg_owes_earl = 40 # Greg owes Earl $40
    greg_after_paying_earl = greg_after_fred_pays - greg_owes_earl

    # L6
    earl_final_money = earl_after_paying_fred + greg_owes_earl

    # L7
    total_greg_earl = greg_after_paying_earl + earl_final_money

    # FA
    answer = total_greg_earl
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Earl will have ${earl_initial_money} - ${earl_owes_fred} = $<<{earl_initial_money}-{earl_owes_fred}={earl_after_paying_fred}>>{earl_after_paying_fred} after paying off his debt to Fred.
Fred will have ${fred_initial_money} + ${earl_owes_fred} = $<<{fred_initial_money}+{earl_owes_fred}={fred_after_earl_pays}>>{fred_after_earl_pays} after being paid by Earl.
But then Fred will have ${fred_after_earl_pays} - ${fred_owes_greg} = $<<{fred_after_earl_pays}-{fred_owes_greg}={fred_after_paying_greg}>>{fred_after_paying_greg} after paying Greg.
Greg will have ${greg_initial_money} + ${fred_owes_greg} = $<<{greg_initial_money}+{fred_owes_greg}={greg_after_fred_pays}>>{greg_after_fred_pays} after Fred paid him.
Then, Greg will have ${greg_after_fred_pays} - ${greg_owes_earl} = $<<{greg_after_fred_pays}-{greg_owes_earl}={greg_after_paying_earl}>>{greg_after_paying_earl} after paying off his debt to Earl.
So together, Greg and Earl will have ${greg_after_paying_earl} + ${earl_final_money} = $<<{greg_after_paying_earl}+{earl_final_money}={total_greg_earl}>>{total_greg_earl}.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Earl will have $90 - $28 = $<<90-28=62>>62 after paying off his debt to Fred.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Fred will have $48 + $28 = $<<48+28=76>>76 after being paid by Earl.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: But then Fred will have $76 - $32 = $<<76-32=44>>44 after paying Greg.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: Greg will have $36 + $32 = $<<36+32=68>>68 after Fred paid him.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L5: Then, Greg will have $68 - $40 = $<<68-40=28>>28 after paying off his debt to Earl.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L7: So together, Greg and Earl will have $44 + $102 = $<<44+102=146>>146.

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'fred_after_paying_greg' (value: 44) was used instead of 'greg_after_paying_earl' (value: 28).
